intro: Phippsia vilfoidea, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its small, pale yellow flowers and hairy, succulent stems that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Phippsia vilfoidea plays a vital role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies in its native habitat.
